Returns: The number of bytes of data read. Once all of the data for this entity has been read, further calls to this method will return zero.
Parameters: byte: An allocated byte array of at least 'size' bytes
int: Offset within the 'data' array at which the data will be placed when read from the stream
int: The number of bytes to read in this pass
Throws: if an error occurred when trying to read the restore data stream
readEntityData(byte[], int, int).Description: Read a record's raw data from the restore stream. The record's header must first have been processed by the @B_android#app#backup#BackupDataInput#readNextHeader_E@ method. Multiple calls to this method may be made in order to process the data in chunks; not all of it must be read in a single call. Once all of the raw data for the current entity has been read, further calls to this method will simply return zero.
readEntityData(byte[], int, int).FullName: public int readEntityData (byte[] data, int offset, int size)

Throws: if the next record header has not yet been read
getKey().Description: Report the key associated with the current entity in the restore stream

Returns: The size of the record's raw data, in bytes
Throws: if the next record header has not yet been read
getDataSize().Description: Report the size in bytes of the data associated with the current entity in the restore stream.

Throws: if an error occurred when trying to read the restore data stream
skipEntityData().Description: Consume the current entity's data without extracting it into a buffer for further processing. This allows a @B_android#app#backup#BackupAgent_E@ to efficiently discard obsolete or otherwise uninteresting records during the restore operation.

Returns: The number of bytes of data read. Once all of the data for this entity has been read, further calls to this method will return zero.

The record's header must first have been processed by the @B_android#app#backup#BackupDataInput#readNextHeader_E@ method. Multiple calls to this method may be made in order to process the data in chunks; not all of it must be read in a single call. Once all of the raw data for the current entity has been read, further calls to this method will simply return zero.

Returns: true when there is an entity ready for consumption from the restore stream, false if the restore stream has been fully consumed.
Throws: if an error occurred while reading the restore stream
readNextHeader().Description: Extract the next entity header from the restore stream. After this method return success, the @B_android#app#backup#BackupDataInput#getKey_E@ and @B_android#app#backup#BackupDataInput#getDataSize_E@ methods can be used to inspect the entity that is now available for processing.

ClassDesc: Provides the structured interface through which a @B_android#app#backup#BackupAgent_E@ reads information from the backup data set, via its @B_android#app#backup#BackupAgent#onRestore_E@ method. The data is presented as a set of "entities," each representing one named record as previously stored by the agent's @B_android#app#backup#BackupAgent#onBackup_E@ implementation. An entity is composed of a descriptive header plus a byte array that holds the raw data saved in the remote backup. The agent must consume every entity in the data stream, otherwise the restored state of the application will be incomplete. A typical @B_android#app#backup#BackupAgent#onRestore_E@ implementation might be structured something like this:
